bug.author: djpugh
bug.description:
Please note that according to <denchmark-link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/reference-pipeline-yaml#steps>https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/reference-pipeline-yaml#steps</denchmark-link> ModuleStep is not supported by yaml - can you at least make sure your docs releases are internally consistent........... (<denchmark-link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azureml-pipeline-core/azureml.pipeline.core.pipeline(class)?view=azure-ml-py#load-yaml-workspace--filename---workflow-provider-none---service-endpoint-none->https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azureml-pipeline-core/azureml.pipeline.core.pipeline(class)?view=azure-ml-py#load-yaml-workspace--filename---workflow-provider-none---service-endpoint-none-</denchmark-link> ) <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>
⚠ Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.
ID: ac092952-4045-3862-e95f-8771d0b67649 Version Independent ID: f33af841-db1e-91e1-790f-56cc7a97040b Content: Machine Learning pipeline YAML - Azure Machine Learning Content Source: articles/machine-learning/reference-pipeline-yaml.md Service: machine-learning Sub-service: core GitHub Login: @sanpil Microsoft Alias: sanpil

comments.comment: ModuleStep is supported by yaml. The article referenced will be updated. Thanks for pointing this out.
